description: From Middle English quoth, quath, from Old English cwæþ (first and third person past indicative of cweþan (“to say, speak to, address, exhort, admonish”)), from Proto-Germanic *kwaþ (first and third person past indicative of Proto-Germanic *kweþaną (“to say”)). Unrelated to quote.

entries.meaning: (archaic or literary, now defective) simple past tense of quethe; said

verbs.description: quoth (third-person singular simple present quoths, present participle quothing, simple past and past participle quothed)

entries.meaning: (defective, modal, auxiliary, nonstandard, archaic) To say.
